Author: dukeleto#7326

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that script prints out the needed curl commands

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/chainstrike/nntools/blob/master/guides/Guide-NOTARYUPDATE.txt#L99

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we used to do it manually, but then I wrote that because I am lazy as fuck

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you don't have to run nn_ips.pl often, that data doesn't change much

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I'm a fan of working harder early so I can be lazy later.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so run it once, and find all your closest peers, use those IP's. Maybe check once a week or month if stuff changes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: IP's of real NN's won't change in the real season, except rarely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but sometimes network conditions change, OVH could have a peering outage, etc..

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if there is some weird stuff with BGP going on, the NN network often notices. Connections between 2 NN's which should be fast start going thru rural China and things break

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: lol @ rural china.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright better notarization performance/numbers if you only talk to those that are close, no timeouts, no huge latency waiting for a response, etc... Just like mining benefits from lower latency

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that script was developed, when there was peering issues between some NNs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some BGP routes were fucked up for OVH/Hetzner or something, and it was trying to route our packets via pigeons in rural china

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so we routed around the damage

Author: Alright#0419
Content: are you actively blocking IPs of nodes that are not close?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: maybe not "actively blocking", but are you *only* connecting to a subset of the network?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we only addnotary the subset of the network that is a reasonable network distance from us, or that don't have issues. we don't block anybody

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and that subset changes as network conditions change

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's not a static list

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: new nodes also propagate with each packet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, this is only the "starting list"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it may not be needed in a healthy network environment, but we were dealing with weird issues last season

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: could you specify what are those weird issues ? I noticed weird things sometimes happened on testnet too, like double notas.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there was broken BGP routes between datacenters that NNs were in

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and our packets had crazy high latency, or never arrived

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: double notarizations should only happen if the notaries are not running the same version

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/bgpstream

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i suggest all NNs subscribe to that to see how scary the inside of the internet can be

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: BGP is what tells the internet where do send packets for IP 1.2.3.4

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's below DNS

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it barely works

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: when myethwallet.com was hijacked and all that ETH stolen, that was a BGP hijack

Author: jorian#4555
Content: `there was broken BGP routes between datacenters that NNs were in`

Author: jorian#4555
Content: this normally happens when noobs are responsible, or it's something done on purpose

Author: jorian#4555
Content: (technically BGP doesn't have anything to do with DNS.. it's routing at the highest level)

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: what is best / fast way to restart NN service ?

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
James, I'm not 100% sure about the version, but I think we're all running the the testnet iguana repo, 1 thing I notice is whenever double nota happens, it seems to me that the NN are split into 2 set, NN from the same set can communicate their mask between themselves, but not with NN from the other set.
For example, these are double nota that just happened recently on BEER
https://beer.kmdexplorer.io/tx/09b17740b67c253848e10dd61f91374ba51019c63b9890c2364a468b78b47229  
https://beer.kmdexplorer.io/tx/dce0ca7cf26efac22c4265c2dadfcd59498d09c34767d0ad31c7b9543e44cb7b
and these are the mask values on my side (notice that about half of them are 0)

Author: PHBA2061#2530
PHBA2061#2530
PHBA2061#2530
Content: @Dr.Terminus  if you want to restart iguana, just  `./m_notary_testnet`

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: I can simply run that command even if it is already running without conflict?

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: My node is stable, but here like 2 days later I've dropped from top 10 to bottom 5 lol

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: that is a script, `nano m_notary_testnet` and you'll see what it does, it `pkill -15 iguana` first, then `git pull` , then relaunch everything
